discussion.content:
As part of creating or modifying a discovery pattern, you can use the Relation and/or Reference condition to create relationships and references between CIs and their related items. This operation is relevant for both infrastructure and application patterns that Discovery uses for horizontal discovery.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-operations-management/page/product/service-mapping/task/t_CreateARelationshipAndReference.html

choices.B: By using the Create Connections operation.
choices.A: Relationships are created automatically for each successful connection section.
choices.C: By using the Create Relation/Reference operation.
choices.D: Relationships cannot be created via patterns.

questions.question_text: How do you create relationships between CIs in a horizontal pattern?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. is correct.

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/product/configuration-management/task/t_CreateCIIdentificationRule.html

questions.question_text: CI identifiers can be viewed under which of the following?

choices.A: updating the acl rules for the CMDB tables in ServiceNow
choices.D: increase the MID Server max payload size
choices.C: increasing the memory allocated to the MID Server app.
choices.B: increase the amount of disk space on the MID Server host

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

Selected Answer: C
C as otherwise you may get an out of memory error from the extra processing

To increase the number of threads, you might have to increase the amount of memory that Java uses. If you configure insufficient memory, an Out of memory error appears in the MID Server log. I'm going with C

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes what may also be required when increasing the max number of threads for a MID Server?

choices.A: Location field for a Discovery Schedule
choices.C: Location field for a Port Probe
choices.D: Location report from the Discovery Dashboard
choices.B: Location field for a parent CI Type

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Confirmed in PDI

Selected Answer: A
A is correct. See https://support.servicenow.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0864114

questions.question_text: Which choice will populate the Location field for a discovered CI?
Which part of Agent Client Collector must be configured to run osquery commands on a CI?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
I selected Policies because the question asks "on a CI."
"Check" defines the queries or osquery commands that are executed.
"Policies" control when and on which CIs those queries are executed.
While the Check defines the specific queries, it is the Policy that triggers and executes them on the corresponding devices. In other words, Check Definitions do not execute on their own, and they must be associated with a Policy to be executed, and therefore I believe the correct answer is Policies.

Selected Answer: C
C.
Example:
Check: A check is created to run the osquery command SELECT * FROM processes; to gather a list of running processes on the CI.
Policy: A policy is set up to run this check on all Windows servers every 24 hours.
Summary:
Checks specify the osquery commands to be run.
Policies determine when and on which CIs those checks are executed.
